body.p:
Hustonville Oct 20. 1863
His Excellency
T. E. Bramlette
Frankfort
Dear Sir

Permit us as two of your old friends and acquaintances to recommend to your consideration as persons well qualified to fill the officers of Colonel & Lieut Col of Military under the State Guard Law, and who would faithfully and truly discharge the duties of sd officers, and are well qualified to meet the present emergency, George B. Cooper of Hustonville for Colonel and Capt Wm Daugherty of Jamesville for Leuit Col. We hope that you will take thier claims under consideration & commission them as Col & Leut Col
Our borders are over run by robbers -- these men will respond to the summon. They have the nerve to meet the state of case now existing - and with enthusiasm, the boys will rally to these men-
With our good wishes for your good health & prosperity We are in haste

very respectfully
Your friend
G. C. Kipp.
R. Blain
